greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number of the form (10^k -1)/9 == 0 (mod prime(n)). with a(1) = a(3) = 0.
comment: For every prime p > 5, {10^(p-1) -1}/9 == 0 (mod p), by Fermat's Little theorem.
reference: Amarnath Murthy, On the divisors of Smarandache Unary Sequence. Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 11, 2000.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Nov 11 2002
